channel.title: Tips for a new coder?
channel.description:
Hi, I'm trying to start coding again. I haven't coded in years and figured I'd make my owner server. The problem is... I have no idea where to start. I don't know which base to start with, how to code anything, or even how to get a development team started.
Any help please?

item.title: Tips for a new coder?
item.dc:creator: @looted_y00 looted y00
item.description:
@looted_y00 wrote:

Use an ide for example “eclipse” it tells you easier ways to do things and instantly tells you if you have an error and how to fix!

Read full topic

item.title: Tips for a new coder?
item.dc:creator: @owwch_u_died owwch u died
item.description:
@owwch_u_died wrote:

Hmmm idk man tell me your username and ill add you if your talking to me, i can help with 317 delta servers. (recommended)

Read full topic

item.title: Tips for a new coder?
item.dc:creator: @RsMakerWoad RsMakerWoad
item.description:
@RsMakerWoad wrote:

[quote=“owwch u died, post:5, topic:456879”][quote author=oldschool-scape link=topic=559820.msg4089219#msg4089219 date=1346168690]

My advice-
Start On Pi[Project instantity]
Simply because its easier to code than the earlier veersion DELTA

Also,I would start as 317,Ive coded for 2 years &ive started on 317

Source+client-
In the server downloads

Have fun&remenber,rsps dont take 5 mins to make

Delta is way more easy then PI xd
If u dont know where to put ur method, Just put it in client.java just as the other mess codes, all piled up in client.java…
[/quote]

Personally, like I said, delta is the only source bases i’ve ever used and i have made 4 servers, it way easier to understand then PI =P[/quote]
Add me on skype?i’d like to get to know you more

Runescape.coder

Read full topic
